nodes.bodyText: Hi @darranl , I would like to confirm my understanding, the reason of this explicit exclusion is to avoid getting Elytron security enabled by default in our default wildfly-core distribution, right? If so, since the security subsystem is in WildFly full, what is making the management interface secured in the default wildfly-core distribution?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3,6 +3,8 @@
 <config xmlns="urn:jboss:galleon:config:1.0" name="standalone.xml" model="standalone">
     <layers>
         <include name="legacy-management"/>
+        <exclude name="management"/> <!-- Other layers may optionally depend on this one. -->

nodes.bodyText: Management interfaces don't use the legacy security subsystem, they use the legacy security realms which are a part of WildFly Core.  The inclusion of "legacy-management" on the prior line still results in secured management interfaces in the configuration.
